skill.name: deploy
skill.description: Enforces local testing before any deployment. MUST be used before running vercel, git push, or any deployment command. Prevents deploying untested code.

skill.author: ChakshuGautam

security_audit.summary: This is a pure documentation skill containing only Markdown guidance. No executable code, no network operations, no filesystem access, and no external command execution. Static findings are false positives triggered by plain text strings being misinterpreted as cryptographic patterns and shell commands. The skill only provides workflow instructions that the user manually executes.

content.value_statement: Deploying untested code to production often causes bugs, downtime, and user-facing errors. This skill enforces a mandatory verification workflow that requires successful build completion, local server startup, browser testing, and passing tests before any deployment command can run.
actual_capabilities: Blocks deployment commands until local build succeeds with zero errors
Starts local development server for verification
Triggers browser testing via Chrome DevTools MCP
Runs test suite if tests exist in the project
Prevents direct production deployment without validation
limitations: Manual verification steps require user attention and interaction
Cannot automatically fix build failures or test errors
Does not run automated integration or end-to-end tests
Relies on user to confirm browser functionality manually

best_practices: Run the deployment skill after every code change, even small ones
Test all user interactions in the browser, not just verify the page loads
Never skip steps to save time because untested deployments cause more delays
anti_patterns: Deploying immediately after build without browser verification
Skipping keyboard and form input testing in the browser
Using deployment as a way to test if code works in production

faq.question: Which deployment platforms are supported?
faq.answer: The skill is designed for Vercel but works with any platform using vercel --prod, git push, or similar commands.

faq.question: Can I skip the browser testing step?
faq.answer: No. Browser testing is mandatory to catch UI bugs, console errors, and interaction issues that builds miss.

faq.question: What if tests fail?
faq.answer: The skill will stop and report the failure. Fix the failing tests before attempting deployment again.

faq.question: Is my data safe during browser testing?
faq.answer: Yes. Browser testing runs locally on your development server. No data is sent to external services.

faq.question: What happens if the build fails?
faq.answer: The skill reports the build error and stops. You must fix compilation errors before proceeding.

faq.question: How is this different from CI/CD pipelines?
faq.answer: CI/CD runs after code is committed. This skill verifies changes locally before any commit or push, catching issues earlier.
